content.description: Contracting Party and Provider related Information
Contracting Party related Information (URL, Legal Type, Contracting Type, Activity, …)

Provided Service (code) and Provider (Reference to Organization)
Legislation impacting the procurement and for which an ID is known
Legislation impacting the procurement and for which no ID is known
Scope of the Procurement addressed with the whole notice
Additional contract nature for the Procedure
Classification for the Main Commodity of the Procedure
Classification for the Additional Commodity of the Procedure
Lot related information covering Tendering Terms, Tendering Process and Purpose
Tendering Procedure information (GPA, Atypical Tool, Deadlines, techniques) for a Lot

Information (Description) about a given Quality Target
Classification for the Main Commodity of a Lot

A location where the Procurement, for the Lot, should take place
Additional Info Provider Technical Identifier Reference
Party formed of one or more organizations than jointly submitted a Tender
One of the member of the Tendring Party
Organization identified as a contractor of one at least of the Main Tenderers of a Tendering Party
Contract settled (or about to be settled) between a Contracting Party and a Tendering Party to satisfy the requirements expressed as part of the Procurement Procedure
Elements about the Extension of the Contract Duration (Indicator, Assets)
Individual Asset characteristics (description, significance, predominance) justifying the Contract extension
Tender (or fragment of a Tender) submitted for a given Lot
Revenues Allocation of tickets sales code
Contract Conditions Description (other than revenue allocation)
Information (Description) about applicable Rewards or Penalties
Outcome of the Procurement Procedure for a given Lot
Tender considered for the award decision
Information associated to a single Change (Section, Description & Procurement Documents)
A Party involved in the Competition from either side (Buyer or Tenderer) with a Legal Entity (Company) and possibly additional Contact Points (touchpoints)
Contact details associated to a given role
